summary.para: Specifies whether to enable line antialiasing; only applies if doing line drawing and MultisampleEnable is FALSE. For more info about this member, see Remarks.
A -typed value that identifies whether conservative rasterization is on or off.
A -typed value that indicates that triangles facing the specified direction are not drawn.
Depth value added to a given pixel. For info about depth bias, see Depth Bias.
Maximum depth bias of a pixel. For info about depth bias, see Depth Bias.
Specifies whether to enable clipping based on distance.

The hardware always performs x and y clipping of rasterized coordinates. When DepthClipEnable is set to the default–TRUE, the hardware also clips the z value (that is, the hardware performs the last step of the following algorithm).
summary.code: 0 < w -w <= x <= w (or arbitrarily wider range if implementation uses a guard band to reduce clipping burden) -w <= y <= w (or arbitrarily wider range if implementation uses a guard band to reduce clipping burden) 0 <= z <= w
summary.para: When you set DepthClipEnable to FALSE, the hardware skips the z clipping (that is, the last step in the preceding algorithm). However, the hardware still performs the "0 < w" clipping. When z clipping is disabled, improper depth ordering at the pixel level might result. However, when z clipping is disabled, stencil shadow implementations are simplified. In other words, you can avoid complex special-case handling for geometry that goes beyond the back clipping plane.
A -typed value that determines the fill mode to use when rendering.
The sample count that is forced while UAV rendering or rasterizing. Valid values are 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, and optionally 16. 0 indicates that the sample count is not forced.
summary.div:
Note If you want to render with ForcedSampleCount set to 1 or greater, you must follow these guidelines:
Don't bind depth-stencil views.
Disable depth testing.
Ensure the shader doesn't output depth.
If you have any render-target views bound () and ForcedSampleCount is greater than 1, ensure that every render target has only a single sample.
Don't operate the shader at sample frequency. Therefore, returns FALSE.Otherwise, rendering behavior is undefined. For info about how to configure depth-stencil, see Configuring Depth-Stencil Functionality.
summary.para: Specifies whether a triangle is front- or back-facing. If TRUE, a triangle will be considered front-facing if its vertices are counter-clockwise on the render target and considered back-facing if they are clockwise. If FALSE, the opposite is true.

Specifies whether to use the quadrilateral or alpha line anti-aliasing algorithm on multisample antialiasing (MSAA) render targets. Set to TRUE to use the quadrilateral line anti-aliasing algorithm and to FALSE to use the alpha line anti-aliasing algorithm. For more info about this member, see Remarks.
Specifies whether to enable scissor-rectangle culling. All pixels outside an active scissor rectangle are culled.
Scalar on a given pixel's slope. For info about depth bias, see Depth Bias.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.FillMode
member.summary: A -typed value that determines the fill mode to use when rendering.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.CullMode
member.summary: A -typed value that indicates that triangles facing the specified direction are not drawn.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.FrontCounterClockwise
member.summary: Specifies whether a triangle is front- or back-facing. If TRUE, a triangle will be considered front-facing if its vertices are counter-clockwise on the render target and considered back-facing if they are clockwise. If FALSE, the opposite is true.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.DepthBias
member.summary: Depth value added to a given pixel. For info about depth bias, see Depth Bias.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.DepthBiasClamp
member.summary: Maximum depth bias of a pixel. For info about depth bias, see Depth Bias.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.SlopeScaledDepthBias
member.summary: Scalar on a given pixel's slope. For info about depth bias, see Depth Bias.

summary.para: Specifies whether to enable clipping based on distance.

The hardware always performs x and y clipping of rasterized coordinates. When DepthClipEnable is set to the default–TRUE, the hardware also clips the z value (that is, the hardware performs the last step of the following algorithm).
summary.code: 0 < w -w <= x <= w (or arbitrarily wider range if implementation uses a guard band to reduce clipping burden) -w <= y <= w (or arbitrarily wider range if implementation uses a guard band to reduce clipping burden) 0 <= z <= w
summary.para: When you set DepthClipEnable to FALSE, the hardware skips the z clipping (that is, the last step in the preceding algorithm). However, the hardware still performs the "0 < w" clipping. When z clipping is disabled, improper depth ordering at the pixel level might result. However, when z clipping is disabled, stencil shadow implementations are simplified. In other words, you can avoid complex special-case handling for geometry that goes beyond the back clipping plane.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.ScissorEnable
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable scissor-rectangle culling. All pixels outside an active scissor rectangle are culled.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.MultisampleEnable
member.summary: Specifies whether to use the quadrilateral or alpha line anti-aliasing algorithm on multisample antialiasing (MSAA) render targets. Set to TRUE to use the quadrilateral line anti-aliasing algorithm and to FALSE to use the alpha line anti-aliasing algorithm. For more info about this member, see Remarks.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.AntialiasedLineEnable
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable line antialiasing; only applies if doing line drawing and MultisampleEnable is FALSE. For more info about this member, see Remarks.

summary.para: The sample count that is forced while UAV rendering or rasterizing. Valid values are 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, and optionally 16. 0 indicates that the sample count is not forced.
summary.div:
Note If you want to render with ForcedSampleCount set to 1 or greater, you must follow these guidelines:
Don't bind depth-stencil views.
Disable depth testing.
Ensure the shader doesn't output depth.
If you have any render-target views bound () and ForcedSampleCount is greater than 1, ensure that every render target has only a single sample.
Don't operate the shader at sample frequency. Therefore, returns FALSE.Otherwise, rendering behavior is undefined. For info about how to configure depth-stencil, see Configuring Depth-Stencil Functionality.

member.name: D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC2.ConservativeRaster
member.summary: A -typed value that identifies whether conservative rasterization is on or off.
